subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_0273_01C9D95B.19C08AF0
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="UTF-8"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

I don't think they would have to know this to make it happen. We already kn=
ow it happens and I bet that the spirit doesn't know exactly how it accompl=
ished it.

Sure, there could be another factor that we just don't know abou=
t that makes EVP possible.

"It is much more credible for the signal to be =
manipulated near the AtoD converter (where EMF changes would have the most =
straighforward result) than in the digital media itself."

Ok well-there yo=
u have it.

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Rj 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoo=
groups.com 
  Sent: Wednesday, May 20, 2009 2:24 PM
  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC=
] Re: I have a question.






        Manipulating EMF is one thing.  But =
directly storing bits on a media is way beyond that.  Bits are not stored i=
n a continuous stream.  They are broken into bytes (little packets) that is=
 totally controlled by the processor and software.  For Elvis to "encode di=
rectly" to the media, he would have to do what that software does to the di=
gital signals coming in from the AtoD converter: he would have to group the=
 bits into (for example) 16 little herds each, decide on the specific bit i=
nterpretation scheme (2's complement?),  find space on the media, update th=
e media's dictionary of where there is free space and where there isn't, li=
nk the herds together with some sort of linked pointer, skip around the are=
as marked 'bad' on the media, update things like date/time modified and siz=
e, respect any kind of ownership permissions on the media, and so on.

    =
    It is much more credible for the signal to be manipulated near the AtoD=
 converter (where EMF changes would have the most straighforward result) th=
an in the digital media itself.

        --- On Wed, 5/20/09, April Abercro=
mbie <april@...> wrote:


          From: April Ab=
ercrombie <april@...>
          Subject: Re: [EVP-=
ITC] Re: I have a question.
          To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
         =
 Date: Wednesday, May 20, 2009, 1:05 PM


          =EF=BB=BF 

          "=
Probably not "directly", since that would mean grandma would have to have q=
uite an understanding of digital encoding, including which bits mean what, =
when, and where."

          Not necessarily- maybe it is that just by tryi=
ng to communicate through our equipment, it happens automatically. They don=
't have to realize that they are manipulating the EMF to make it occur, it =
just happens. It's the nature of being of pure energy.

            ----- O=
riginal Message ----- 
            From: Rj 
            To: EVP-ITC@yahoog=
roups .com 
            Sent: Wednesday, May 20, 2009 1:55 PM
            S=
ubject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.



                  Probably =
not "directly", since that would mean grandma would have to have quite an u=
nderstanding of digital encoding, including which bits mean what, when, and=
 where.  But even on a digital recorder, there is still an analog element (=
the Analog to Digital converter) which takes the sound pressure waves, as r=
epresented by some analog electronic detection element, and converts that i=
nto digital.  That way, long departed uncle Ebenezer does not need to do an=
ything digital.  Under this scenario, if sound is not being heard in the ro=
om, but is being induced into the circuitry, then it would be round about t=
hat AtoD converter (assuming it isn't other just plain old noise in the dig=
ital elements).  

                  Someone with more electronic know-how =
than me might be able to better pinpoint the area in the analog portion of =
that AtoD pipeline where it would be most likely it could be influenced by,=
 say, an EM field, and that would also occur in a normal analog tape record=
er.

                   
                  --- On Wed, 5/20/09, April Aberc=
rombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com> wrote:


                    =
From: April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com>
            =
        Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.
                    T=
o: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
                    Date: Wednesday, May 20, 20=
09, 12:29 PM



                    This is what I think true EVP is Eric. =
Not and actual sound emitting a sound wave in the environment, but EMF mani=
pulation in order to imprint the message directly to the recording media. I=
t doesn't matter if it is analog or digital.

                    If the so=
und that is recorded emitted a sound wave in the physical environment, then=
 it is really a disembodied voice, and not true EVP.

                     =
 ----- Original Message ----- 
                      From: Eric VanDuzer 
 =
                     To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
                      Se=
nt: Wednesday, May 20, 2009 11:16 AM
                      Subject: Re: [EV=
P-ITC] Re: I have a question.


                      Actually that I would=
 buy into  But the question I have when you say "tape" are you talking old =
analog tape or digi recording.  Here is the reason I believe it can be do "=
real-time".  As you all know we use electromagnetic Field detectors in fiel=
d investigations.  If a spirit can manipulate that with to show that they a=
re there by giving off a EM field whose to say they can't manipulate a magn=
etic strip of a tape or even the electronics in a Digi recorder to speak in=
 "real-time".



                      On Wed, May 20, 2009 at 1:01 PM, Kri=
stin Morris <ckmorris95@sbcgloba l.net> wrote:





                       =
 Okay I have another one for you to think about.. I tape a session and revi=
ew it later..  even a day later.  Upon review the message that comes over i=
s about something that =E2=80=98just happened=E2=80=99 while I was reviewin=
g or happened after taping?  Is it possible that spirit can manipulate the =
recording AFTER recording has stopped or even manipulate the audio while re=
viewing?



                        An give you an example of this I was re=
cording one day and I reviewed the audio the next day.  While reviewing =E2=
=80=93 about half way through =E2=80=93 the message =E2=80=9CYour mother is=
 calling=E2=80=9D was found.  I saved it and moved on and within two second=
s my mom called.  You say it is a coincidence except that I hadn=E2=80=99t =
spoken to my mother in over a year.  During this same conversation with her=
 =E2=80=93 we sorta made amends and I told her the story of the =E2=80=98se=
cret=E2=80=99 I had found out about a family member having a child out of w=
edlock in the late 1920s.  Quick backstory.. I found out about this out-of-=
wedlock birth through my genealogy research and contacted spirit through th=
e box and I was promptly told to keep it secret and which I promised to do=
=E2=80=A6



                        Well in this conversation with my mom =
after not speaking for a year I told her what I had found out.  When the te=
lephone conversation ended with my mom=E2=80=A6 I was amazed that the recor=
ding had told me she would call right be fore she did =E2=80=93 even though=
 the audio was recorded the previous day.  I proceeded to go back to review=
ing the audio and the very first thing I heard was:  THAT WAS SUPPOSED TO B=
E A SECRET =E2=80=93 YOU LIED.



                        Maybe they can ma=
nipulate =E2=80=98real-time=E2=80=99 literally??? ?



                    =
    k




--------------------------------------------------------

       =
                 From: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com [mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups=
 .com] On Behalf Of April Abercrombie
                        Sent: Wednesd=
ay, May 20, 2009 11:36 AM 


                        To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroup=
s .com

                        Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a questio=
n.










                        2 different things happening-that' s w=
hy. When you get EVP that everyone understands,  it is outward, in the envi=
ronment. Not a communication through subconscious means.



               =
         EVP that people swear they hear, but noone else can make sense, ma=
y be a message to them via subconscious means. That isn't to say that ALL E=
VP's like this are true messages, I am sure alot are just matrixing.



   =
                     But then that is how the art of scrying starts-matrixi=
ng. Like the Rorschach tests. The images you matrix with those gives the ps=
ychologist an insight into your mind.



                        By gazing =
into a dark, reflective surface, you start to see cloudy images. At first, =
you will just be matrixing faces in the clouds and not getting much substan=
ce. Try it, you will see what I am saying. With practice, you start to see =
clear, concise images.



                        I think that is what happ=
ening with audio as well.



                        We already know for a =
fact pareidolia can occur in audio as well as visual stimulus.



         =
                 ----- Original Message ----- 

                          F=
rom: Eric VanDuzer 

                          To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com=
 

                          Sent: Wednesday, May 20, 2009 10:19 AM

      =
                    Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.



      =
                    yes I understand its personal to that particular indivi=
dual but why can't I hear it.  I have gotten some very personal EVPs throug=
h the traditional investigation way (not through a box or anything of that =
matter) that all others have heard.

                          On Wed, May =
20, 2009 at 12:15 PM, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. c=
om> wrote:



                          "If one person is not meant to hear=
 it they won't hear it (I guess I am not quite ready to believe that one ri=
ght yet)." 



                          I don't know for sure about that o=
ne either, but I am not ready to discount it either, especially since I stu=
mbled across the possibility of audible scrying. But I am sure alot of peop=
le don't believe in scrying at all either.



                          Wha=
t makes it a possibility to me is that so many people are hearing things th=
at are very personal, but stuff they would not have come up with on their o=
wn.





                            ----- Original Message ----- 

       =
                     From: Eric VanDuzer 

                            To: =
EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 

                            Sent: Wednesday, May=
 20, 2009 10:09 AM

                            Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: =
I have a question.



                            I think that is the probl=
em I am having though Jim.  When you say "work them over till you hear them=
"  to me I should not have to work them over till I hear them.  Yes taking =
out the ambient and background noise is one thing.  But if you just keep on=
 listening to them with different enhancements you are bound to hear someth=
ing (matrixing).  If one person is not meant to hear it they won't hear it =
(I guess I am not quite ready to believe that one right yet).  I think you =
all know what I am getting at.  

                            On Tue, May 1=
9, 2009 at 9:11 PM, James W. Hyslope <clockdryve@yahoo. com> wrote:



    =
                        Well, for myself...I don't "clean" them up to much =
because I really don't know HOW :) (well a little bit)Since I've only been =
at it for a couple weeks. BUT if you can clean up something to where you ca=
n FIND what was there to begin with "you have done no harm" I hear alot mor=
e than others I guess, and I haven't enhanced many of my evp's.*If anyone i=
s able to clean them up...I DO promise you will hear what I say is correct)=
Pretty BOLD statement, but if you are able to clean it up with better softw=
are (please do for others too) I will be more than happy to "listen" where =
I made a mistake...I can only LEARN from it :) I have done some DEEP enhanc=
ements to a few of my evp's...from the begining I could only hear clicks an=
d thumps.....but after messing with that area, eventually I would hear the =
true voices (and can tell if male or female...approximat e age) and underst=
and the mood also....these where extreamly modified, and I feel that I coul=
d NOT have added enough "simple" enhancements that would ADD a voice....ful=
l of emotion and distinct syllables :) And some just can't hear them for wh=
at ever reason be it equipment that is used to hear (pc-headphones- speaker=
s- ears) know one has the perfect match of all these things. Check out "Jim=
's RR-DR60 EVP's" in the files section....work them over till you hear them=
. I really can't do much more :)--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com, Eric VanDu=
zer <evanduzer@.. .> wrote:
                            >
                 =
           > Now I may be biased to the "investigation" way of doing things=
. I do clean
                            > up evps if I hear something and =
can't make it out do to ambient noise. So
                            > hea=
r is my question. When do you stop cleaning up? Wouldn't to much
          =
                  > enhancing "taint" the results? To me the more enhancing=
 you do the less
                            > convincing it becomes. I hop=
e noone finds this offensive, it is not meant
                            >=
 to be I am just really curious. The way I look at it is that if you have t=
o
                            > do so much enhancing to find anything, was =
there really something there to
                            > begin with. A=
re we just making ourselves believe there is something there??
            =
                > 
                            > Eric
                     =
       >
